text: St Andrew's Church is a 13th-century church in Bramfield, Suffolk. It has a separate 12th-century tower standing in the church grounds. It is one of 38 existing round-tower churches in Suffolk and the only detached example in the county. The ground before the altar of the church is paved with a number of fine ledger slabs of members of the Rabett and Nelson families. Both the church and the tower are Grade I listed buildings. Ledger slab of Bridgett Applewhait ==References== == External links == * *St Andrews Church official Website *St Andrew's church in Bramfield *Website with photos of Bramfield St Andrew, a round-tower church Category:Grade I listed churches in Suffolk Category:Church of England church buildings in Suffolk
title: St Andrew's Church, Bramfield
